params.taskDescription:
Identify the location of points <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>C</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">C</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math>, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math>, and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>F</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">F</annotation></semantics></math>.
params.detailedSolution:
Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> is located at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">( - 5, - 2)</annotation></semantics></math>; Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math> is located at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mn>4</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(- 3,4)</annotation></semantics></math>; Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>C</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">C</annotation></semantics></math> is located at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>6</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(3, - 6)</annotation></semantics></math>;  Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math> is located at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mo>−<!-- − --></mo>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(5, - 2)</annotation></semantics></math>; Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math> is located at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mn>3</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mn>2</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(3,2)</annotation></semantics></math>; Point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>F</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">F</annotation></semantics></math> is located at <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mo stretchy="false">(</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mo>,</mo>
  <mn>5</mn>
  <mo stretchy="false">)</mo>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">(5,5)</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Describe the line that includes point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> and point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math>.
params.detailedSolution:
Points <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>A</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">A</annotation></semantics></math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>B</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">B</annotation></semantics></math> are on the straight line <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>A</mi>
      <mi>B</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>↔<!-- ↔ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overleftrightarrow {AB}</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Describe the line from <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math> to point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>F</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">F</annotation></semantics></math>.
params.detailedSolution:
The line that begins at point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>E</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">E</annotation></semantics></math> in the direction of point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>F</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">F</annotation></semantics></math> is a ray, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>E</mi>
      <mi>F</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>→<!-- → --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overrightarrow {EF}</annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription:
Describe the line from <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>C</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">C</annotation></semantics></math> to point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math>.
params.detailedSolution:
The line from point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>C</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">C</annotation></semantics></math> to point <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mi>D</mi>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">D</annotation></semantics></math> is a line segment <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>C</mi>
      <mi>D</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo accent="false">¯<!-- ¯ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overline {CD} </annotation></semantics></math>.

params.taskDescription: Does this figure represent a plane?
params.detailedSolution:
Yes, this represents a plane. One reason is that the figure contains four points that are not on the line <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><semantics><mrow>
  <mover>
    <mrow>
      <mi>A</mi>
      <mi>B</mi>
    </mrow>
    <mo>↔<!-- ↔ --></mo>
  </mover>
</mrow><annotation encoding="LaTeX">\overleftrightarrow {AB}</annotation></semantics></math>.
